questions: Which of the following is responsible for change in the motion of an object?
What will happen to a body moving with a constant speed along a straight line in absence of any external force?
option2: It continues to move with uniform velocity

questions: To change the state of rest or motion of a body, what should overcome the inertia of the body?
Force needed to change the momentum of an object depends on which of the following factors?
option3: Time rate at which momentum is changed

questions: What will happen if the body at rest is made to move in a straight line and obstructed by an opposite force?
option3: The body will continue to move in the same direction with the same speed

questions: If the mass of a body and its velocity is doubled, then what will be the effect on the linear momentum of the body?
Which has more momentum: a car of mass 300 kg stopped at a red light or a bike of mass 150 kg moving at 15 mph?
If friction, air resistance, and all external forces are zero then what could be said about a body at rest?
option3: It will continue at rest forever

questions: A body has constant momentum in time t. What is the force applied on it?
A bird strikes the windshield of an aircraft. What can you say about the forces on the bird and on the aircraft?
option1: Force on the bird is greater than the force on the aircraft
option2: Force on the bird is smaller than force on the aircraft
option3: Force on the bird is = force on the aircraft
option4: Bird experiences force but the aircraft does not

questions: Which of the following is incorrect regarding the action and reaction pair?
option2: They act on two different bodies
option3: They act on bodies in contact
option4: Their effect on both bodies in consideration is the same

questions: A dog plays with a ball. Consider the action force as the dog catching the ball with his teeth. What is the reaction force?
option1: The friction of the ground on the ball.
option2: The friction of the ground on dog
option3: The force on the ball by the dog's teeth.
option4: The force of the ball on the dog’s teeth

questions: Which two forces are balanced when a person is sitting on the ground?
option1: Weight balanced by friction of ground
option2: Weight balanced by weight of ground
option4: Weight balanced by frictions and gravity force

questions: What is the effect of the action and reaction forces experienced by the 2 bodies which are always equal in magnitude?
option1: They produce accelerations of equal magnitudes.
option2: They may not produce accelerations of equal magnitudes.
option3: They produce velocities of equal magnitudes.
option4: They will never produce accelerations of equal magnitudes

questions: Acceleration produced by action and reaction forces may not be equal. Select the correct reason for this statement.
option1: Each force acts on a different mass
option2: Each force is not always equal
option3: Each force has different amount of frictional force involved
option4: Each force acts on a different area

questions: F = (G)(M)(m/d²) Choose the correct statement about the quantity G
option1: It depends on the value of g at the place of observation
option2: It is used only when the earth is one of the two masses
option3: It is the greatest on the surface of the earth
option4: It is same irrespective of the place of observation

questions: If there is a decrease in mass of one of the two objects, there is _________ in the gravitational pull between the two objects.

Choose the correct statement for the given situation: ‘Coconut falling from a tree.’
option1: Only the earth attracts the coconut
option2: Only the coconut attracts the earth
option3: Both the coconut and the earth attract each other
option4: Both the coconut and the earth repel each other

questions: More force is required to bring body A into a unit acceleration compared to that for body B. Which body has more mass?
Choose the correct statement.
option1: Mass of a body on planet A is 60 kg while on planet B is 20 kg
option2: Mass of a body on planet A and B is 60 kg
option3: Mass of a body on planet A and B is 60 N
option4: Weight of a body on planet A and B is 60 kg

questions: How should cattle shed be designed?
option1: Closed rooms to prevent smell of dung from coming out
option3: Sloping floor so as to stay dry and help in cleaning

questions: Which of the following is not a reason to do cross-breeding of different breeds of chicken?

option3: To have small size chicken for commercial meat production
option4: To have chicken with colorful feathers for commercial feather selling

questions: How can hybridization be done in cattle?
option2: By cross-breeding between local and foreign breeds

questions: Why fish and a few other varieties of aquatic animals are used as food?
option1: They constitute good sources of protein.
option2: They constitute good sources of minerals
option3: They constitute good sources of vitamins
option4: They constitute good sources of carbohydrates

questions: Why is Bee-keeping done?

option2: To increase protein content in fish

questions: Taste and quality of honey produced by bees will depend on what factors?

option1: Crop’s ability to resist damage from pest attack
option2: Crop’s ability to resist weed infestation
option3: Crop’s ability to tolerate adverse climatic conditions

questions: What are the factors for which variety improvement in crops are done?

Preventive methods such as proper seedbed preparation, timely sowing of crops, intercropping and crop rotation help in which of the following?
Which of these are the advantages of mixed cropping or inter cropping?
option1: It prevents the depletion of selective nutrients.
option2: It enhances the production by increasing the soil fertility.
option3: It ensures a greater number of crops within same year

questions: Why is it necessary to maintain distance between two crops while sowing seeds?
option2: To prevent competition between the crops for sunlight, nutrients, water, etc.

questions: Select all the sustainable methods of controlling weeds in an agricultural field.

option2: It prevents the building up of diseases and pests of a particular crop
option3: It enhances the production by increasing the soil fertility

questions: What are some advantages of mixed cropping?
option1: The risk of total crop failure due to an uncertain monsoon is reduced
option2: Chances of pest infestation are greatly reduced
option3: Fertility of the soil is improved by growing two crops simultaneously

questions: Which of the following sustainable methods help to control weed?

questions: Which of the following agents is responsible for turning the Taj Mahal yellow?

option1: Strong wind erodes the rock and carries sand particles with it
option2: Water wears away hard rocks over periods of time and carries soil particles with it

questions: Uneven heating of air over the land and water-bodies causes which of the following?

questions: Where are the essential proteins and lipids required for cell membranes manufactured?

questions: Detoxification of organic compounds like barbiturates and ethanol in the liver is carried out by which cell organelle?

questions: What is the similarity between mitochondria and plastids?
